Recipe.Description: Salmon sautéed in Sesame Oil with Bonito/Wasabi sauce

Method.Step: Season salmon with salt and pepper and let stand to allow salt to penetrate the meat.

Set a pot to boil with 1-2 cups of water. When the water is boiling, add the Bonito flakes, yes it is very fishy smelling, but most of the odor boils off rather quickly and it will mellow out. Reduce heat to a simmer.

Heat sesame oil in a sauté pan over high heat, at the point where the oil just begins to smoke, add the salmon filet and cook for a minute or so, until the salmon is well browned, then flip and brown the other side. Use tongs to hold the salmon and brown all the edges, you are going for a browned, crispy outer coat -the salmon won't be fully cooked at this point.
Remove salmon to a dish and hold.
Add shallots to the sauté pan, off the heat, and sauté briefly.
Strain the Bonito broth into the pan and return to the heat.
Reduce the liquid by half. Return the salmon to the pan and cook at a simmer for five minutes, turning once.
Return the salmon to the holding dish.
Increase the heat until the liquid is almost completely reduced.
With the pan off the heat, add the vermouth.
Return to the heat and reduce again by half.
Add wasabi to taste. Swirl a pat of butter through this sauce, pour it over the salmon. Garnish with chives and serve immediately.
